page.title: 05CORNBURY DEER PARK
page.content: The {Cornbury Deer Park} was begun in the reign of {Queen Anne. }The Park contains some very old trees, notably single {Oaks, Lime avenues planted l50 {yrs ago and Beech avenues 250yrs old.} 2/3rds of the Beech were dangerous - some plugged with concrete to preserve them - and have been felled and re- planted. All mature trees are browsed to 6ft height by deer. {New trees }are protected by {6ft weldmesh tubes}. The traditional {Fallow} herd is kept at c.{450 head, buck to doe ratio l to 6} to prevent undue aggression during rut. {25 Formosan Sika Deer }were int- roduced from Woburn in l975; there are now {80}. They are tamer than Fallow. An {8ft stone wall}keeps them inside. In {Winter}they are fed {hay and min- {eral licks}to supplement the grazing. {Venison}from the {cull} is sold through a gamedealer.
